meanings.definition: A person or thing that disrupts or causes disturbance.
meanings.sent1: The loud disrupters in the classroom made it hard to focus on the lesson.
meanings.sent2: The construction noise outside was a disrupter to the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous disrupters in the park kept rearranging the benches for fun.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected power outage was a disrupter to our evening plans.
meanings.sent5: The barking disrupters in the neighborhood woke everyone up in the middle of the night.

meanings.definition: A device or substance that interrupts a process or system.
meanings.sent1: The antivirus software acted as a disrupter to the computer virus, stopping it from spreading.
meanings.sent2: The alarm clock is a disrupter that wakes me up every morning.
meanings.sent3: The sprinkler system malfunctioned and became a disrupter, soaking everyone in the office.
meanings.sent4: The traffic lights are essential disrupters that regulate the flow of vehicles.
meanings.sent5: The loud thunder was a disrupter to the peaceful night, startling everyone awake.
